intro: Leucospermum septemdentatum, commonly known as the seven-toothed pincushion, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its striking, cone-shaped inflorescences that resemble a pincushion. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that are surrounded by long, white bracts, creating a visually appealing display. It is a hardy shrub that thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight. Leucospermum septemdentatum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
